Publisher: Common Council, Corporation of the City of New York
Credit Line: The Elisha Whittelsey Collection, The Elisha Whittelsey Fund, 1959
Who: Common Council, Corporation of the City of New York
Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History: The United States and Canada, 1800–1900 A.D.
Description: A view in the northern part of Central Park, New York, with paths, shrubbery and two stone buildings, one a former blacksmith's shop and the other used by George Washington as a headquarters when this area was part of a fort. A view of the far side of the Hudson River in the distance, published in "Manual of the Corporation of the city of New York" (known as "Valentine's Manual").
